cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles ESE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west then turning west-southwest toward the south-central Texas coast, passing very near or just south of Corpus Christi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: between Port Mansfield and Mesquite Bay, Texas (near Padre Island National Seashore)

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Port Mansfield to Mesquite Bay, TX; Storm Surge Warning from Port Mansfield to Sargent, TX; Tropical Storm Warning from Mesquite Bay to High Island, TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-central Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward to High Island, including Corpus Christi Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) expected to begin later this morning with a 55 % chance of occurrence; brief hurricane-force gusts possible as the center passes south of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water levels in Corpus Christi Bay could rise 3–5 ft above ground if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 18 inches possible, producing flash flooding and rapid rises on small streams.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; a few coastal plain tornadoes possible.
